text: milty or bubble tea has become a global
craze but is most popular in asia and
vietnam is not an exception it has
recently become an inexpensible part of
dating or outing with friends or
everyday tea of office people join me
today as i make some of the most popular
kinds of bubble tea available in vietnam
and the glutinous and chewy bobas and
some other amazing toppings that comes
with bubble tea i will show you how to
make the traditional boba really cute
and delicious panda mochi topping and
cheese rubies
recipes
after many trials i finally come up with
this recipe that makes boba with the
most pleasant textures it can be kept
until the next day you just have to
microwave for about 30 seconds and they
are nice to eat again in a small bowl
combine 50 gram of brown sugar with 150
ml of warm water stir well to dissolve
the sugar next in a large mixing bowl
combine 90 grams of tapioca starch 10
grams of rice flour 10 grams of cacao
powder and mix well then gradually add
in the sugar syrup make sure that it is
heated to about 70 to 80 degrees celsius
knit well until the dough comes together
and form an elastic piece of dough pinch
a piece of dough and roll into thin
sticks then cut into small pieces and
try to make them as even as possible
roll each piece between your palms into
little small tapioca pearls
drop them into a bowl of tapioca starch
and shake to coat so they won't stick to
each other then strain off the excess
starch bring a saucepan of water to a
foam boil cook the boba pearls until
they float to the surface after cooking
for about 15 minutes you cover the lid
turn off the heat and leave to sit for
about 30 minutes then transfer the
cooked pearls to a bowl of ice cold
water and rinse well about three to four
times to remove the sticky layers of
starch outside each purse mix the boba
pearls with a tablespoon of sugar to
give them some taste and also to prevent
sticking one of my favorite boba tea
toppings is of course the tea rubies
they are translucent and chewy on the
outside with the soft rich creamy and
cheesy fillings the making of these
rubies would require some patience but
it's totally worth it
refrigerate cream cheese or head couch
cheese until firm then cut in two dices
roll each dice over some powdered sugar
leave to sit for about one to two
minutes until the sugar is partially
melted then roll over some tapioca
starch then freeze for about 15 to 20
minutes repeat the coating process for
about two to three times until the
cheese is well coated with a thick layer
of starch this is to make sure that when
you boil them
the outer layer is thick enough to
protect the feelings from leaking out
then bring a saucepan of water to a foam
boil gently drop in the cheese dices and
cook over low heat until they float to
the surface then transfer them to a bowl
of ice cold water then drain after about
a minute another topping not so
well-known but very cute and delicious
is panda mochi in a lush mixing bowl
combine 150 grams of glutinous rice
flour 50 grams of rice flour 10 gram
powder sugar a pinch of salt and mix
well we actually add about 150 ml of
warm water at about 80 degrees celsius
mix well till combined and knead well
until the dough is formed take out about
one-fifth of the dough and mix with half
a teaspoon of cacao powder and knead
until well combined you will get a brown
piece of dough divide the remaining
white dough into smaller pieces to the
size of about your finger section then
shape into small balls divide the brow
dough into tiny bits and stick to the
white ball to make the head of a panda
very simple but looks so cute right then
boil them until they fall to the surface
and remove transfer to a bowl of ice
cold water
[Music]
now we can start making the bubble tea
let's start with the most traditional
kite brew 20 gram of black tea with 300
ml of boiling water for about 20 to 30
minutes then strain and add 50 ml of
sweetened condensed milk 70 grams of
sugar and 80 grams of whipping cream add
a pinch of salt and stir well add the
pop-up pose to the glass top with ice
and pour in the milk tea wow so good the
tea is sweet and rich the boba pearls
are perfectly soft and chewy such a much
making heaven no wonder why the
youngsters are so addicted to them
another bestseller at small bubble tea
chops is brown sugar boba with milk
combine 150 grams of brown sugar a pinch
of salt and a dash of water in a
saucepan and bring to a boil add the
cooked boba bowls and simmer on low heat
until slightly thickened turn off the
heat and leave to cool to serve this
drink add the popa balls in brown sugar
syrup into a glass and swirl to coat the
sides of the glass with the syrup add
some ice and pour in the food fat milk
and enjoy if the caffeine in the milky
could make you lose lip then this ring
is the perfect choice for you next
recipe is thai red ice milk tea a thai
drink that is loved by the vietnamese
people firstly combine 25 grams of thai
red tea with 300 ml of boiling water for
about 20 minutes then string
add 50 gram sugar 50 gram of sweetened
condensed milk and 50 gram milk powder
and stir well add a pinch of salt
pour into a glass of ice and top with
your favorite toppings if you enjoy
watching the moments the tea blends and
dissolve into fresh milk then try out
the next two drinks chop tan butterfly
pea flour in 200ml of water for about 10
minutes you will get the tea with really
beautiful blue color pour 150 ml of milk
and 50 ml of whipping cream into a glass
of ice then pour in the blue tea to get
that ombre effect you can do similarly
with matcha if you prefer some green
color you can serve with your favorite
toppings and share beautiful memories
with your friends i hope all the milk
tea fans are happy with all the recipes
that i'm giving out to you today don't
forget to like share the videos and
subscribe to my channel for more amazing
recipes like this i will see you then
next time bye
